置.definition: to install; to place; to put; to buy

置之不問.definition: to pass by without showing interest (idiom)

置之不理.definition: to pay no heed to (idiom); to ignore; to brush aside

置之度外.definition: to give no thought to; to have no regard for; to disregard

置之死地而後生.pinyin: zhi4 zhi1 si3 di4 er2 hou4 sheng1
置之死地而後生.definition: (idiom based on Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1zi3 Bing1fa3]) to deploy one's troops in such a way that there is no possibility of retreat, so that they will fight for their lives and win the battle; to fight desperately when confronted with mortal danger; to find a way to emerge from a dire situation

置之腦後.definition: to banish from one's thoughts; to ignore; to take no notice

置信.definition: to believe (what sb claims) (usually used in the negative); (math.) confidence (interval etc)

置入.definition: to insert; to implant; to embed; to introduce (a new element) into

置喙.definition: to offer an opinion; to comment (on the issue); to have a say (in the matter)

置換.definition: to permute; permutation (math.); to displace; displacement; to replace; replacement

置於.definition: to place in; to put in (a position)

置氣.definition: to get angry; to take offense

置若罔聞.definition: to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear

置裝.definition: variant of 治裝|治装[zhi4 zhuang1]

置裝費.definition: variant of 治裝費|治装费[zhi4 zhuang1 fei4]

置諸高閣.definition: lit. place on a high shelf; to pay no attention to (idiom)

置買.definition: to purchase; to buy (usu. real estate)

置身事外.definition: (idiom) not to get involved; to stay out of it

置頂.definition: to sticky (an Internet forum thread etc)
